Argentina: Military coup deposed Yrigoyen, starting the 'Infamous Decade'
Australia: New South Wales batsman Don Bradman scores a world record first-class individual innings of 452 not out in a Sheffield Shield match against Queensland

In the Third Test at Leeds against England, Don Bradman scored a Hundred before Tea, a Hundred before lunch, and a Hundred by the end of the day's play, 309 in Total. He went on to make 334. Altogether in his 52 Test career, Bradman scored 29 Hundreds, 12 Double Hundreds and 2 Triple Hundreds. This is therefore the fastest Triple Hundred in Test History.
Phar Lap wins his only Melbourne Cup
Bangladesh: Chittagong Armoury Raid by Surya Sen.
Belgium: Birth of future king Baudouin of Belgium
Brazil: A general election is held; in the presidential election,s the result is a victory for Júlio Prestes of the Republican Party of São Paulo, who receives 57.7% of the vote. Vital Soares is elected vice-president, but never takes office.

The assassination of João Pessoa Cavalcânti de Albuquerque, governor of Paraíba, by João Duarte Dantas, stirs up a wave of bad feeling toward the federal government and the outgoing president Washington Luís, who is accused of bearing the "moral responsibility".
1930 Curuçá River event: The area of Curuçá River near latitude 5° S and longitude 71.5° W experiences a meteoric air burst (also known as the Brazilian Tunguska event).
The state capital of Paraíba, formerly Parahyba, is renamed João Pessoa, in memory of its assassinated governor.
Incumbent President Washington Luís is deposed. A military junta, led by General Augusto Tasso Fragoso, temporarily takes control of the country.
Beginning of the Vargas Era: The ruling junta hands power and the presidential palace to Getúlio Vargas.
The National Institute of Metrology Standardization and Industrial Quality (INMETRO) is founded.
Burma: Nationalist and leftist Dobama Asiayone founded
Chile: Fuerza Aérea de Chile (Chilean Air Force) founded.
Colombia: Enrique Olaya Herrera is president of Colombia
Germany: German federal election, 1930: The SPD retained a plurality of seats in the Reichstag. The Nazi Party gained ninety-five seats.
Haiti: The Forbes Commission, sent by U.S. president Herbert Hoover to investigate Haiti's political situation, arrives in the country
Louis Eugène Roy is designated temporary president by state decree
Senator Sténio Vincent is elected to a six-year term as president
Fietta, the first Apostolic Nuncio (diplomatic representative of the Roman Catholic Church) to Haiti, arrives in Port-au-Prince
India: Salt Satyagraha, the civil disobedience movement, begins with the Dandi march
Indinesia: Sukarno's famous nationalist speech, 'Indonesia Accuses', given as defence in his political trial.
Japan: Wushe incident – a rebellion on Taiwan
Philippine: Partido Komunista ng Pilipinas (PKP, Communist Party of the Philippines) is formally established by Crisanto Evangelista at Tondo, Manila.
Russia: The Karakalpak Autonomous Oblast was transferred to the Russian SFSR.
Slovenia: Italian fascists discover some TIGR's cells and five members of TIGR (other sources of Borba) are killed at Bazovica.
Taiwan: Wushe Incident: The Seediq people attack a Japanese police station and in response the Japanese intensify their subjugation of the Atayal aborigines
USA: The Smoot–Hawley Tariff Act was signed into law.
Vietnam: Emperor Bảo Đại (1925–1945) became ruler of Vietnam.
